import React from 'react'; import './Adventure_Games.css' export default function Graphic_adventures() { return(

Graphic adventures


Early graphic adventure games were called "interactive fiction." And just as the name implies, the gameplay is graphic-based, meaning players use their keyboard to input commands in response to the game-programmed story arch or situation, such as “get shovel,” “grab sword,” or “go North.” With graphic adventures, programmers spend quite a bit of development time working out various responses to the players’ inputs.


Notable games:

Ori and the Blind Forest, Dead Cells, Rogue Legacy

Notable developers:

Motion Twin, Moon Studios
); }
